title: How to Check Your Credit Score for Free (Without Getting Scammed)
seoTitle: Check Your Credit Score for Free
summary: You don‚Äôt need to pay or get tricked into a subscription just to see your credit score. Here's how to check your score and full report for free ‚Äî and what to watch out for.

body.raw:
## Introduction Knowing your credit score is one of the smartest financial moves you can make ‚Äî but **you should never have to pay to see it**. Unfortunately, some websites advertise ‚Äúfree credit score‚Äù offers that sneak in monthly charges or hidden fees. Here's how to safely check your score and full credit report for free ‚Äî and avoid getting scammed. *** ## Your Credit Score vs. Credit Report - **Your credit score** is a number between 300‚Äì850 that reflects how risky you are to lenders. - **Your credit report** is a detailed history of your loans, payments, and accounts. You‚Äôll usually want to check both ‚Äî the score gives you a snapshot, and the report shows what‚Äôs affecting it. ## How to Check Your Credit Report for Free You can get your **full credit report from all three bureaus** (Equifax, TransUnion, Experian) for free at: üëâ [AnnualCreditReport.com](https://www.annualcreditreport.com) This is the **only official site** backed by the federal government. You can request all three reports at once or space them out. > üí° Tip: As of 2023, reports are free **weekly**, not just once a year. ## How to Check Your Credit Score for Free Your score isn‚Äôt always included with your report, but you can get it free from: - **Credit card companies** (Chase, Capital One, Discover, etc.) - **Bank apps** (Wells Fargo, Bank of America, etc.) - **Free credit tools** like Credit Karma or Credit Sesame These sources usually show a **VantageScore** or **FICO Score**, depending on the provider. ## Watch Out for Scams and Tricks Avoid these common traps: - Sites that ask for a credit card to ‚Äúunlock‚Äù your score - Free trials that turn into paid subscriptions - Fake clones of AnnualCreditReport.com Always check the URL and never share sensitive info unless you're on a trusted site. ## Why This Matters - Many people discover **identity theft** or errors only after checking their report - You‚Äôll need your score to qualify for housing, loans, or credit cards - Regular checks help you track progress if you're rebuilding credit For more on building credit safely, check out [How Paying Rent Can Boost Your Credit Score](./how-paying-rent-can-boost-your-credit-score) or [What Credit Score Do You Need to Rent a Home?](./what-credit-score-do-you-need-to-rent-a-home) *** ###### References
